required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: rTMS for PTSD Comorbid With Major Depressive Disorder
clinical_study.official_title: 5Hz Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Comorbid With Major Depressive Disorder

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see how well a treatment called "Repetitive Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation" works for patients who struggle with symptoms of both posttraumatic stress disorder and major depressive disorder.

detailed_description.textblock: This study aims to evaluate the safety and efficacy of repetitive transcranial magnetic stimulation (rTMS) for adults with comorbid posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and major depressive disorder (MDD). Although standard rTMS uses stimulations delivered to the left prefrontal cortex at 10 pulses per second, prior work has shown that other stimulation frequencies may work for both PTSD and MDD. In this study, we examine the efficacy of left-sided 5Hz in patients with PTSD and MDD, hypothesizing that this lower frequency will improve PTSD and MDD symptoms.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Score on PTSD Checklist for DSM-5 (PCL-5)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to final TMS session (up to 40 sessions over up to 8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: This self-report scale is called: "PTSD Checklist for DSM-5" (abbreviated PCL-5) (see https://www.ptsd.va.gov/professional/assessment/adult-sr/ptsd-checklist.asp). Total PCL-5 score ranges from 0 to 80. Analysis of treatment effect on symptom severity will be evaluated by change in PCL-5 total score from baseline (pre-TMS) to endpoint (post-TMS)(or LOCF); Paired t-test compares the mean total PCL-score for the group at the two time points. A higher total score on the PCL-5 scale corresponds with more severe PTSD symptoms than a lower total score. A greater change from baseline to endpoint would correspond with better treatment outcome.

primary_outcome.measure: Total Score on Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report (IDS-SR) Scale
primary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline to final TMS session (up to 40 sessions over up to 8 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: This self-report scale is called "Inventory of Depressive Symptomatology, Self-Report" (Abbreviated IDS-SR). IDS-SR Total Scores Range from 0 to 84, with a higher score reflecting greater depressive symptom severity. Paired t-test compares the change in mean total IDS-SR score from baseline (pre-TMS) to endpoint (last TMS session) or LOCF. A greater change reflects a better outcome than lesser change.

arm_group.description: Stimulation at pulse frequency of 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000/session. Sessions delivered once/day on weekdays for up to 40 sessions.

intervention.description: Up to 40 sessions of TMS delivered with the first 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper schedule over 3 weeks. Treatment is adjunct to ongoing stable pharmacotherapy.

link.description: Online ahead of print article with all methods and results

group.title: TMS Prescription
group.description: 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000 Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: Stimulating DLPFC at 5 Hz for up to 40 treatment sessions overall. 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper over 3 weeks. There will be a post treatment assessment 72 hours after final treatment, and then again 1 month after the final treatment.

group.title: TMS Prescription
group.description: 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000 Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: Stimulating DLPFC at 5 Hz for up to 40 treatment sessions overall. 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper over 3 weeks. There will be a post treatment assessment 72 hours after final treatment, and then again 1 month after the final treatment.

A higher total score on the PCL-5 scale corresponds with more severe PTSD symptoms than a lower total score. A greater change from baseline to endpoint would correspond with better treatment outcome.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline to final TMS session (up to 40 sessions over up to 8 weeks)

group.title: Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation (TMS)
group.description: TMS 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000 Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: Stimulating DLPFC at 5 Hz for up to 40 treatment sessions overall. 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper over 3 weeks. There will be a post treatment assessment 72 hours after final treatment, and then again 1 month after the final treatment.

reported_events.desc: Adverse event data collected through (1) Response of participants to queries by study clinicians during treatment sessions and during study-specific assessment visits (2) spontaneous reports initiated by participants.

group.title: TMS Prescription
group.description: 5Hz delivered over L DLPFC. Intensity: 120% of Motor Threshold, 5 Sec Train, 14 Sec Inter-Train Interval, Frequency: 5Hz, Total Pulses: 3000 Transcranial Magnetic Stimulation: Stimulating DLPFC at 5 Hz for up to 40 treatment sessions overall. 35 sessions delivered over 7 weeks, and final 5 treatments delivered in taper over 3 weeks. certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
